title: The Best 5-Year Wedding Anniversary Gifts
text:
25 items in this article 6 items on sale! Photo: Courtesy of the retailers

A few things might have changed since you got married five years ago — maybe you moved to a new city, bought a house, or even had a baby. What hopefully hasn’t changed, though, is how much you love your spouse and enjoy spending time together. So when your fifth anniversary rolls around, you’ll want to get your husband or wife a gift that honors the special things you share — whether that’s hosting dinner parties, taking care of your plants, or simply enjoying your morning coffee together.

If you’ve been following the traditional anniversary gift guidelines, you know that the recommended five-year gift is wood. Here at the Strategist, we’ve covered lots of wooden things, and below we’ve rounded up some of our sturdy favorites that should last you through the next five years — and beyond. And if you’re looking ahead, check out our guide to the best tenth anniversary gifts for things to buy when that milestone is reached.

For the caffeinated couple

Chemex Ottomatic Coffee Maker It doesn’t get much easier than this automatic Chemex pour-over machine recommended by writer Diane Chang. She says, “It has the reliability and old-school sex appeal of a Chemex, but the convenience of an automatic coffee maker.” Even though it’s high-tech, it has the same wooden collar as the original Chemex, which gives it a nice, handcrafted look. $350 at Bed Bath & Beyond Buy

For the couple who has a toddler

ECR4Kids Bentwood Multipurpose Kids Table and Chair Set Aesthete parents who turn their noses up at brightly colored plastic toys will appreciate this bentwood playset that doubles as a coffee table. Writer Laura Perciasepe says, “it looks like something Herman Miller would make and charge a thousand dollars for.” $150 at Amazon Buy $150 at Amazon Buy

For the couple who has plant babies

For the couple with a bathtub

Teak Bathtub Caddy Made from water-resistant teak, this tray lets you prop up a tablet or book for reading in the bath, and even has a wine-glass holder. Writer Verena von Pfetten is a fan and says, “It makes me feel almost productive, even if all I’m really doing is lounging, drinking, and catching up on prestige television.” $40 at Bed Bath & Beyond Buy

For the couple with a home office

Tribesigns Computer Desk with Hutch and Bookshelf If you and/or your spouse work from home, this wood desk with a bookshelf and storage hutch will likely make you feel more productive. $180 at Amazon Buy $180 at Amazon Buy

For the couple with a backyard

Brybelly Molkky Portable Outdoor Lawn Game Originally from Finland and popular in Paris, Mölkky is similar to bowling and will delight your summer guests who are tired of cornhole. According to Strategist managing editor Maxine Builder, it’s “slow-paced enough to drink a beer and chat with your friend while you play, which is really the main reason to play any lawn game.” $50 at Amazon Buy $50 at Amazon Buy

For the couple with a (tiny) backyard

Äpplarö Outdoor Storage Bench If your outdoor space is limited, this storage bench offers both seating and a place to stash bug repellent, cushions, or other essentials. It’s made from stained acacia wood, which is ideal for weathering the elements. $129 at Ikea Buy

For the couple who still hasn’t framed their wedding photos

Framebridge Cairo Frame Sure it’s been half a decade, but better late than never, right? This burl wood frame would also work for displaying vacation or family photos, and with Framebridge’s custom framing service, you can simply send a file from Instagram or Facebook so you really don’t have any excuses. $85 at Framebridge Buy

For the couple who collects coffee-table books

For the couple who collects cookbooks

For the couple who likes to entertain

Artek Alvar Aalto Stool 60 These colorful stacking stools are a favorite of interior designers. Store them in a stacked-up spiral and pull them out when you need additional seating. From $280 at Design Within Reach Buy

For the couple who hosts dinner parties

Christopher Knight Home Idalia Walnut Finish Dining Chair (Set of 2) These dining-room chairs are surprisingly affordable, so you can easily buy a few sets for the next time you host. $149 at Amazon Buy $149 at Amazon Buy

For the couple who likes a big salad

For the couple redoing the living room

Brightech Charlotte LED Tripod Floor Lamp You can use part of this accent lamp’s wood base as a little shelf, making it a truly multifunctional piece. Writer and comedian Billy Domineau admits that he’s resold the lamp for more than $100 on Craigslist since it looks more expensive than it actually is. $70 at Amazon Buy $70 at Amazon Buy

For the couple redoing the bedroom

Broadridge 6 Drawer Double Dresser If you’re looking for a sophisticated dresser, interior designer Ross Cooper says this one “has the look of a really rich, oak mid-century piece without the price tag. Its cool brown stain makes it quite versatile and contemporary, and the unique brass drawer pulls are the perfect luxe accent to glam it up.” $540 at Wayfair Buy

For the couple redoing the bathroom

For the couple lacking closet space

Umbra Hub Ladder $76 (was $80, now 5% off) End arguments about overstuffed closets or one spouse leaving clothes on the floor with this leaning wall ladder that works as a garment rack. $76 at Amazon Buy $76 at Amazon Buy

For the hippie couple

Palo Santo Wood Hand-Pressed Incense Burning palo santo, which means holy wood in Spanish, gives off a natural, piney smell that Strategist editor Katy Schneider compares to “a spring hike after a rainstorm.” Great for those days when you’d love to be out in nature but are stuck indoors. $12 at Goop Buy

For the couple who always leaves love notes

For the couple working on their knife skills

For the couple without air conditioning

Stadler Form OTTO Fan $158 (was $200, now 21% off) Your partner will appreciate ditching the plastic fan in favor of this mid-century-style one from the Swiss brand Stadler Form. Besides being stylish, the bamboo fan features adjustable legs to change the airflow angle and a removable back panel for easy cleaning $158 at Amazon Buy $158 at Amazon Buy

For the (ecofriendly) couple without air conditioning

Monte Carlo Maverick Energy Star 60'' Ceiling Fan We dubbed this balsa-wood beauty the “Prius of ceiling fans” thanks to its extremely efficient motor. It uses only 27 watts of energy (much fewer than your standard 60-watt light bulb) and will only set you back $5 in energy costs a year. It’s also got an elegant, modern design and six speeds to keep you cool. $627 at Amazon Buy $627 at Amazon Buy

For the couple who handwashes their cashmere sweaters

For the couple with a spotless home

Andrée Jardin Vintage-Inspired French Exterior Ash Wood Broom If you and your partner take pride in your home’s cleanliness, you’ll love using this humidity-resistant French ash-wood broom that’s nice looking enough to show off. After all, Schneider tells us artisan brooms are having a moment. $82 at Food52 Buy

For the couple who has everything else

Handmade Wood Cricket House $31 (was $73, now 58% off) This delicate wooden cricket cage, which is available on Amazon and looks exactly like one senior editor Anthony Rotunno bought in China, will surely start conversations once visitors see it hanging on a gallery wall or displayed on a bookshelf. $31 at Amazon Buy $31 at Amazon Buy

description: We found wood gifts (the traditional fifth wedding anniversary gift) for couples, including a Framebridge frame, Umbra ladder, Dansk salad bar, John Boos cutting board, Stadler Form fan, Palo Santo incense, Alvar Aalto stools, and more.
